alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coke and southern Nolan Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147, or near Champion, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackwell, Hylton, Maryneal, Fort Chadbourne, Sanco, Champion, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, Oak Creek Reservoir, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147 and Camp Boothe Oaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
